full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 243 Filed 04/23/21 Page 5 of 5
The Hon. Alison J. Nathan
April 22, 2021
Page 5
For these reasons, Ms. Maxwell respectfully requests that this Court hold an evidentiary hearing on her motions to suppress and that it rule on the merits of her arguments before the trial on the non-perjury counts.
Respectfully submitted,
Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
CC: Counsel of Record
The Court agrees with the position set forth in this letter that, unless the Government agrees to forgo any use of the documents subject to the motions to suppress at trial on the non-perjury counts, the Court must resolve those motions prior to that trial. The Court will resolve the motions in due course. SO ORDERED.
SO ORDERED.
4/23/2021
ALISON J. NATHAN, U.S.D.J.
DOJ-OGR-00003971

text_blocks.content:
The Hon. Alison J. Nathan
April 22, 2021
Page 5

For these reasons, Ms. Maxwell respectfully requests that this Court hold an evidentiary hearing on her motions to suppress and that it rule on the merits of her arguments before the trial on the non-perjury counts.

The Court agrees with the position set forth in this letter that, unless the Government agrees to forgo any use of the documents subject to the motions to suppress at trial on the non-perjury counts, the Court must resolve those motions prior to that trial. The Court will resolve the motions in due course. SO ORDERED.

SO ORDERED.
4/23/2021
ALISON J. NATHAN, U.S.D.J.

additional_notes: The document appears to be a court filing with a signature from Judge Alison J. Nathan. The text is mostly printed, with two signatures present.
